meanings.definition: A Jewish prayer recited in memory of the dead.
meanings.sent1: During the funeral, the rabbi led the congregation in reciting the kaddishim.
meanings.sent2: Every year on the anniversary of his passing, the family gathers to say the kaddishim together.
meanings.sent3: The kaddishim echoed through the synagogue, bringing comfort to the mourners.
meanings.sent4: As the kaddishim rose to the heavens, it felt like a bridge between the living and the departed.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the kaddishim lingered in the air, a solemn tribute to those who had passed.

meanings.sent1: In the synagogue, the shelves were filled with old prayer books containing many kaddishim.
meanings.sent2: The rabbi asked the students to recite all the kaddishim they knew for practice.
meanings.sent3: The kaddishim on the bookshelf seemed to multiply overnight, puzzling the caretaker.
meanings.sent4: The kaddishim lined up on the page like soldiers ready for duty.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the sound of pages turning as the congregation searched for the right kaddishim to recite.
